page.title: 01SUMMARY OF THE AREA
page.content: This area is rural, consisting mainly of open countryside.It includes Painswick Beacon,some farmland,and the northern part of the village of Painswick.There are two major roads, the A46 that links Bath with Cheltenham and the B4073 which runs between Stroud and Gloucester.There is also the Painswick Beacon or Hill.At the very top is a triangulation, or mapping point.Situated on the Beacon is Painswick golf course- there is a club house there too.In the area there are six farms,Holcombe Farm is the main one.It also includes Painswick House which is a historic building open to the public and Paradise House which is a home for mentally handicapped people.In our part of the village is the fire station and police station,also a doctors' surgery where most Painswickians go for treatment.
